36/**
37 * \file
38 *
39 * This file has routine(s) for cleaning up incoming DNS messages from
40 * possible useless or malicious junk in it.
41 */
42
43#ifndef ITERATOR_ITER_SCRUB_H
44#define ITERATOR_ITER_SCRUB_H
45struct sldns_buffer;
46struct msg_parse;
47struct query_info;
48struct regional;
49struct module_env;
50struct iter_env;
51
52/**
53 * Cleanup the passed dns message.
54 * @param pkt: the packet itself, for resolving name compression pointers.
55 * the packet buffer is unaltered.
56 * @param msg: the parsed packet, this structure is cleaned up.
57 * @param qinfo: the query info that was sent to the server. Checked.
58 * @param zonename: the name of the last delegation point.
59 * Used to determine out of bailiwick information.
60 * @param regional: where to allocate (new) parts of the message.
61 * @param env: module environment with config settings and cache.
62 * @param ie: iterator module environment data.
63 * @return: false if the message is total waste. true if scrubbed with success.
64 */
65int scrub_message(struct sldns_buffer* pkt, struct msg_parse* msg,
66 struct query_info* qinfo, uint8_t* zonename, struct regional* regional,
67 struct module_env* env, struct iter_env* ie);
68
69#endif /* ITERATOR_ITER_SCRUB_H */
70
